intro: Rosa rubiginosa var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces oval, reddish-brown fruits called hips, which are rich in vitamin C. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its ornamental value is complemented by its historical use in traditional medicine.
